greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a(n) = largest prime less than the smallest prime dividing (2n-1).
comment: Placing a 1 between each term of this sequence gets sequence A117365.
link: Robert Israel, Table of n, a(n) for n = 2..10000
example: a(13) = 3 because smallest prime dividing 25 is 5 and largest prime less than 5 is 3.
maple: with(numtheory): a:=proc(n): prevprime(factorset(2*n-1)[1]): end: seq(a(n),n=2..90); # _Emeric Deutsch_, Apr 22 2006
results.author: _Leroy Quet_, Mar 10 2006
